content.title: Homes For Intellectually Impaired Persons
content.department: Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance
content.details: This scheme provides shelter and care for Mentally Deficient Children who are in need of care and protection.
eligibility: Applicant should be a Mentally Deficient Child (MDC)
Percentage of disability should be 40% and above
Permanent residents of Maharashtra are eligible
exclusions: Applicants from neighboring states are not eligible
content.application_process: The application process is entirely free of cost.
documents_required: Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate of Maharashtra

faqs.question: What Is The Full Form Of MDC?
faqs.answer: The full form of MDC is 'Mentally Deficient Children'.

faqs.question: In Which Year Did The Juvenile Justice (Care & Protection Of Children) Act Come Into Existence?
faqs.answer: The Juvenile Justice (Care & Protection of Children) Act came into existence in the year 2000.

faqs.question: Is It Mandatory For The Child To Be An Orphan In Order To Be Eligible For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, in order to be eligible for this scheme, the applicant should be an orphan.

faqs.question: How Many MDC Homes Under This Scheme Are Non-Granted?
faqs.answer: The numbers of MDC homes are 19 out of which 14 are granted and 5 are non-granted.

faqs.question: Is It Mandatory For The Child To Be Mentally Deficient In Order To Be Eligible To Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a Mentally Deficient Child (MDC).

faqs.question: What Are The Objectives Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: In this scheme, Mentally Deficient Children who are in need of care and protection are admitted into shelter homes.

faqs.question: Are There Any Eligibility Criteria Regarding The Percentage Of Disability Of The Applicant?
faqs.answer: Yes, the percentage of disability of the applicant should be 40% and above.

faqs.question: Is The Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate Of The State Of Maharashtra, A Mandatory Document For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate of the State of Maharashtra is a mandatory document for this scheme.

faqs.question: Is This A State Funded Or A Centrally Funded Scheme?
faqs.answer: This is a 100% State Funded scheme.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee?
faqs.answer: No, the entire application process is entirely free of cost.

faqs.question: Is There Any Compensation For The Delay In The Disbursal Of The Scheme Benefits?
faqs.answer: No, there is no such mention in the scheme guidelines.

faqs.question: Can Applicants From The Neighboring States Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Telangana, Etc Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only the citizens who are permanent residents of the state of Maharashtra are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The URL To The Website Of The Dept. Of Social Justice & Special Assistance?
faqs.answer: The URL to the official website of the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra is - https://sjsa.maharashtra.gov.in/

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The Link To The Scheme Guidelines?
faqs.answer: The Scheme Guidelines can be found at this link - https://sjsa.maharashtra.gov.in/en/scheme-category/disability-welfare.

faqs.question: What Is The Address Of The Department Of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government Of Maharashtra?
faqs.answer: The address of the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra is: 437, Shankar Sheth Rd, Police Colony, Swargate, Pune, Maharashtra 411042.

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The Addresses Of The District Social Welfare Offices?
faqs.answer: The addresses of the District Social Welfare Offices can be found at - https://sjsa.maharashtra.gov.in/en/contacts.

faqs.question: Where Can I Post My Grievances Related To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: You can post your grievances at the Grievance Redressal Portal by the Govt. of Maharashtra: https://grievances.maharashtra.gov.in/en.

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The Format Of The Application Form? Is It Available Online?
faqs.answer: You need to visit the District Social Welfare Office and request a hard copy of the format of the application form for the scheme from the concerned authority.
